node.title: 'A great way to start 2022': ABC to employ over 50 regional journalists after Facebook, Google deal
node.description: The ABC announces plans to hire more than 50 journalists to report from over 20 regional locations, following deals it struck with Facebook and Google.
node.content:
["The ABC has announced plans\u00a0to hire more than 50\u00a0journalists to report from over 20 regional locations, following deals it struck with Facebook and Google.", "The new jobs will be spread across\u00a0all states and the Northern Territory, with the positions expected to be filled by early 2022.", "Larger regional patches will get more support, in areas such as\u00a0Horsham, Burnie, Dubbo, Wagga Wagga, Katherine, Esperance, Karratha, Longreach and Toowoomba.", "Smaller bureaus will be trialled in\u00a0Warragul, Batemans Bay, Carnarvon, Hervey Bay and Charleville, while individual journalists will be stationed in\u00a0Swan Hill, Whyalla, Victor Harbor, Northam and Gladstone.\u00a0", "More remote locations will also see ABC journalists embedded there for a shorter period of time.", "As part of the announcement,\u00a0several new national specialist rounds will be added to the ABC's regional team, covering\u00a0water, mining, social affairs and health.", "ABC managing director David Anderson said the additional reporters would be placed in areas that had\u00a0previously been \u00a0\"news deserts\".", "\"We want to provide greater coverage of regional stories in areas that are under-served by the media,\" he said.", "", "
ABC journalist Melanie Groves interviews a stubborn foal in Clermont.\u00a0(ABC Rural )
", "The ABC entered into commercial negotiations with the digital platforms after the\u00a0News Media Bargaining Code came into effect in February, \u00a0", "An agreement was signed with Facebook this week following an agreement with Google last month.", "Revenue from both will go towards increasing the ABC's investment in regional and rural journalism across Australia."]
